other_tests.findings: Plasma osmolality rose to 315 mosmol/kg while urinary osmolality remained low at 400 mosmol/kg and plasma VP concentration was 1.3 pg/mL.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The boy had more than a 50% increase in urinary osmolality after the administration of exogenous VP, confirming the diagnosis of neurohypophysial diabetes insipidus.

other_tests.procedure_name: Genetic sequencing of VP prohormone gene
other_tests.findings: Heterozygosity for the normal sequence and a T to G transition mutation at nucleotide 2110 (codon 116) of the VP prohormone gene.
The mutation creates an extra Sau96 I restriction site and produces fragments indicating the presence of the mutation in affected individuals.
